intro: Lithospermum affine, commonly known as redroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its reddish roots and blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or along roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Lithospermum affine is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
